synopsis.text:
Suddenly, the barren wasteland that Earth has become is disrupted by the speed of a young man named Daigo, riding a super cycle with his robotic black panther companion. They arrive at Victor City, a beacon of civilization amidst the desolation, only to find it under siege by a technologically advanced group of fanatics. Daigo and his robotic pet are quickly enlisted into the defense force, but the battle seems all but lost against the relentless invaders. Just as hope fades, a colossal robot, Gordian, emerges from the shadows to repel the attackers.

Unbeknownst to Daigo, his late father, a brilliant scientist, had designed Victor City and left him an extraordinary inheritance - the very same robot system that saved the city, Gordian. Daigo's sister, Saori, who has been managing the city, urges him to accept his legacy and join the Mechacon mechanic combat 18th regiment unit, the protectors of Victor City against the ongoing threats from the Madokuta organization.

"Gordian" is a thrilling and captivating science fiction mystery-drama that unravels the enigmatic identities of Daigo and his robotic panther, the motivations of the invaders, and the true nature of Gordian's intervention, engaging viewers of all ages in a gripping tale of survival, legacy, and the fight for a better future.
